metadata.title: CVE-2023-1076 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux Kernel. The tun/tap sockets have their socketUID hardcoded to 0 due to a type confusion in their initializationfunction. While it will be often correct, as tuntap devices requireCAP_NET_ADMIN, it may not always be the case, e.g., a non-root user onlyhaving that capability. This would make tun/tap sockets being incorrectlytreated in filtering/routing decisions, possibly bypassing network filters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1076` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-aws - 5.4.0-1104.112~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-azure - 5.4.0-1110.116~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1107-gcp - 5.4.0-1107.116~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-ibm - 5.4.0-1051.56~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-oracle - 5.4.0-1103.112~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1088-raspi - 5.4.0-1088.99~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
